{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3558277,"name":"Joe Witcpalek","username":"wits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wits/{size}/110752_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T14:14:18.057Z","cooked":"

Has anyone seen an issue with loop overruns where if you restart robot code on the driver station, it goes away and if you restart again it happens again?

We’ve run a test in the pits and we see no loop overruns on one restart, but if we restart it again we’ll see spikes.

Our initial thought was processes weren’t getting cleaned up on restart, but when looking at that the processes running were identical (except for process IDs on the restarted processes.

The work around seems to be counting the restarts and making sure we are on an odd number of restarts.

If anyone has any insights, please let me know.

Thanks

Weird question, but what sensors do you use on the robot?
We used a color sensor on our coral gripper, it gave us the same issue as you mentioned.
Now we switched to a limit switch and we don’t have that problem anynore

We have banner sensors, limit switches., cancoders, limelights …

We are running 2 CANivore buses in addition to the Rio bus.

Yes, known issue. We have a fix (Disable code reboot while killing robot process by ThadHouse · Pull Request #778 · wpilibsuite/GradleRIO · GitHub) that we are testing and will be doing a release early this week.
